steps.title: Get a bottle each of Grand Marnier, Kahlua, and Baileys Irish Cream.
steps.content: Get a bottle each of Grand Marnier, Kahlua, and Baileys Irish Cream. You will use an even ratio of each liquor in the shot, so get bottles of the same size if you plan on making a lot. Put all the bottles in front of you on a bar or table so you’re ready to prepare this classic layered shot! [1] X Research source You can also use homemade Baileys Irish Cream in the shot. Use another type of coffee liqueur instead of Kahlua if you don’t have it.

steps.title: Fill 1/3 of a shot glass with Kahlua or other coffee liqueur.
steps.content: Fill 1/3 of a shot glass with Kahlua or other coffee liqueur. This is the easiest layer of the shot to pour and you don’t need any special technique. Pour slowly so that you don’t fill more than 1/3 of the shot glass. [2] X Research source Repeat this in multiple shot glasses if you are preparing more than 1 shot.

steps.title: Pour Baileys Irish Cream slowly over the back of a spoon into the glass.
steps.content: Pour Baileys Irish Cream slowly over the back of a spoon into the glass. Stop pouring when the shot glass is 2/3 full. When you pour over the back of the spoon it slows the flow of the liquor enough so that the layers won’t mix. [3] X Research source A long-handled bar spoon is ideal for preparing this shot. If you don’t have a bar spoon use a medium-sized dining spoon.

steps.title: Pour Grand Marnier slowly over the back of a spoon until the shot glass is full.
steps.content: Pour Grand Marnier slowly over the back of a spoon until the shot glass is full. Use the same technique you used to pour the Irish cream so that the layers don’t mix. The B-52 shot is now ready to drink! [4] X Research source As an alternative to a spoon, use a pourer spout on your bottle of liquor. Hold the pourer spout against the side of the glass and very slowly let the liquor pour out down the side of the shot glass. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Lift the shot to your mouth and drink it all at once.
steps.content: Lift the shot to your mouth and drink it all at once. Enjoy the subtle mix of the coffee, orange, cream, and whiskey flavors. This classic shot is great when enjoyed as a dessert! [6] X Research source Legend has it that the B-52 shot was created by a bartender in the 1970s who was a huge fan of the band The B-52s. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Pour vodka, Grand Marnier, cranberry juice, and lime juice in a shaker with ice.
steps.content: Pour vodka, Grand Marnier, cranberry juice, and lime juice in a shaker with ice. Fill a cocktail shaker halfway with ice. Combine 1 oz (30 ml) each of vodka, Grand Marnier, and cranberry juice with 1/2 oz (15 ml) of fresh-squeezed lime juice in the shaker and put the lid on. [8] X Research source For more citrus flavor use citrus-flavored vodka or add a dash of orange bitters. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Shake the cocktail shaker until the outside of the shaker frosts over.
steps.content: Shake the cocktail shaker until the outside of the shaker frosts over. Shake the ingredients together vigorously for at least 15 seconds. Make sure the lid is on tight before you begin to shake. [10] X Research source Shake hard enough that you can hear the ice rattling around inside. You want to mix all the ingredients together thoroughly and break up the ice.

steps.title: Strain the cocktail into a chilled martini glass and garnish with a lime twist.
steps.content: Strain the cocktail into a chilled martini glass and garnish with a lime twist. Store the martini glass in a freezer or fill it with ice water for 5 minutes to chill it. Uncap the top part of the cocktail shaker or use a julep strainer to pour the drink into the martini glass. The cocktail is now ready to serve and drink! [11] X Research source

steps.title: Wrap 3 handfuls of ice cubes in a clean towel and crush them with a hammer.
steps.content: Wrap 3 handfuls of ice cubes in a clean towel and crush them with a hammer. Use a muddler or rolling pin to hit the wrapped ice and crush it if you don't have a hammer. Break up the ice until you have crushed ice of mixed sizes from pea-sized to the consistency of snow. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Fill a glass with ice water for 5 minutes to chill it, then fill it with crushed ice.
steps.content: Fill a glass with ice water for 5 minutes to chill it, then fill it with crushed ice. After 5 minutes, empty the ice water out and fill the glass close to the brim with crushed ice. Make sure the glass has crushed ice of various sizes. [13] X Research source Salt the rim of the glass prior to filling it with ice if you want. Rub the rim with a lime wedge and flip the glass over onto a plate of kosher salt after you empty out the ice water. Press gently to adhere the salt to the rim and flip the glass back over. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Combine tequila, agave, lime juice, and Grand Marnier in a shaker with ice.
steps.content: Combine tequila, agave, lime juice, and Grand Marnier in a shaker with ice. Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Pour in 1.5 oz (45 ml) of silver tequila, 1/2 oz (15 ml) of agave syrup, 1/2 oz (15 ml) of fresh-squeezed lime juice, and 1/4 oz (7.5 ml) of Grand Marnier. [15] X Research source Use simple syrup instead of agave syrup if you don’t have it.

steps.title: Shake the cocktail for 15-20 seconds and strain it into the chilled glass.
steps.content: Shake the cocktail for 15-20 seconds and strain it into the chilled glass. Stop shaking when the outside of the cocktail shaker frosts over. Make sure you can hear the ice knocking against the sides, top, and bottom of the shaker as you mix everything together. [16] X Research source If you are making more cocktails, empty out the ice and repeat the mixing process for each cocktail.

steps.title: Garnish the cocktail with a few lime wedges and serve or drink it.
steps.content: Garnish the cocktail with a few lime wedges and serve or drink it. Cadillac Margaritas are sure to be a hit in hot weather or paired with Mexican food. Multiply the measurements of the ingredients and premix everything for large batches. Store it in the fridge in a pitcher until ready to serve.

steps.title: Pour 1 shot of Grand Marnier into a snifter.
steps.content: Pour 1 shot of Grand Marnier into a snifter. Serve neat, with no ice, to appreciate the complex flavors. Swirl the liqueur in the glass and take small sips to savor the taste. [17] X Research source Add one cube of ice if you prefer your liqueur chilled.

steps.title: Mix 1 part Grand Marnier with 3 parts ginger ale.
steps.content: Mix 1 part Grand Marnier with 3 parts ginger ale. Serve in a glass over ice cubes and garnish with a lime wedge. Enjoy the blend between the intense aroma of Grand Marnier and the peppery flavor of ginger ale. [18] X Research source Squeeze the lime wedge into the glass first then add the same wedge as garnish.

steps.title: Warm up 1 shot of Grand Marnier and mix with 3 oz (90 ml) of hot coffee.
steps.content: Warm up 1 shot of Grand Marnier and mix with 3 oz (90 ml) of hot coffee. Add brown sugar if you want to sweeten it and garnish with whipped cream. This is the perfect after-dinner coffee to enjoy with company! [19] X Research source Put the shot of Grand Marnier liqueur in the microwave for 7-10 seconds to warm it up.
